Based on your preference for sitcoms, I'd highly recommend "The Nanny". This show revolves around a wealthy couple who hire a young girl from Finland to take care of their newborn, leading to a series of hilarious misunderstandings and cultural clashes. It stars Fran Drescher in the title role as the lovable nanny, along with other notable actors like Charles Shaughnessy and Daniel Davis.

If you're interested in a more dramatic narrative, "Alex in Wonderland" is an intriguing film that delves into the life of a director struggling to balance commercial success with artistic integrity. The movie features appearances from renowned figures such as Jeanne Moreau and Paul Mazursky. Enjoy your movie time!

Both "Pan's Labyrinth" and "The Imitation Game" could be intriguing choices for you!

"Pan's Labyrinth", a Spanish-language film, immerses viewers in an eerie yet captivating fantasy world during the Falangist Spain of 1944. Starring Doug Jones and Ivana Baquero, it's a unique blend of history and mythology.

"The Imitation Game", on the other hand, tells the compelling true story of Alan Turing, an English mathematical genius who played a crucial role in cracking the German Enigma code during World War II. Benedict Cumberbatch delivers a powerful performance in this gripping historical drama.
